w:r.w:t: The teacher will explain natural resources by using TPR, sentence frames, and vocabulary. Students will study these words and phrases: earth, nature, natural resources, trees, animals, rocks, water, oil, metal, Metal/water/trees/animals/rocks give us ____,
What natural resources do you see?
At completion of this lesson, students will be able to:
Recognize, spell, and pronounce the words for natural resources
Spell and pronounce common associated words
Use sets of words in complete sentences
Word List: earth, natural, trees, animals, rocks, water
This slide will always be the
-branded opener slide that the teacher will display as the student enters the classroom.
Greet your student and introduce the lesson concept: “Today, we are going to be learning about the natural resources!”
and circle some things we see in nature.
and say it. Have the child repeat.
Circle the things we see in nature,
Clear the screen and have the child circle the
In the white space, spell and write the word,
use natural resources from the Earth.
and have the child repeat. Circle the natural resources one at
time and state that they are natural resources, like this:
The sun is a natural resource, the wind is a natural resource, the trees are a natural resource, the water is a natural resource,
the air is a natural resource.
Underline the sentence and say it while pointing the pictures. Have the child repeat.
Trees give us paper and houses
Circle the picture and say the word,
Trees give us paper and houses,
Animals give us meat and clothes.
Circle the picture and say the word,
Animals give us meat and clothes,
Rocks give us streets and glass.
Circle the picture and say the word,
Rocks give us streets and glass,
Water helps us cook and wash.
Circle the picture and say the word,
Water helps us cook and wash,
Oil gives us plastic and gas.
Circle the picture and say the word,
Oil gives us plastic and gas,
Metal gives us tools and cars.
Circle the picture and say the word,
Metal gives us tools and cars,
Match the natural resource to the word and read each word
Model drawing a line from the picture of metal to the word,
and say the name of the resource. Have the child repeat the rest the same way.
Circle and name the natural resources you see in this picture.
Model circling one natural resource and say its name. Ask the child to circle more natural resources and say their name.
Name the natural resource in the first picture
Draw a picture of how we use that resource
Circle the first picture and have the child say the name of the natural resource.
Encourage the child to draw one thing we get from water.
Name the natural resource in the first picture
Draw a picture of how we use that resource
Circle the first picture and have the child say the name of the natural resource.
Encourage the child to draw one thing we get from water.
Name the natural resource in the first picture
Draw a picture of how we use that resource
Circle the first picture and have the child say the name of the natural resource.
Encourage the child to draw one thing we get from water.
Ask the child to circle the natural resources and name them.
Circle the natural resources and name them.
Ask the child to circle the natural resources and name them.
Draw a product we get from each natural resource. Use each resource in a complete sentence (
Animals give us food, Water helps us cook, etc.)
Model drawing a product of a natural resource in one of the squares. Encourage the child to draw a
picture in the other three boxes.
Find and name the natural resources in this picture
Circle the picture and talk about how pretty it is. Ask the child to circle and name the natural resources they see. Ask the child what resource they like (if they like to swim or climb mountains.)

earth, natural, trees, animals, rocks, water
earth, natural, trees, animals, rocks, water)
Teacher will prompt student to draw a picture to represent
earth, natural, trees, animals, rocks, water
through pictures. One prompt at a time.
Teacher will write words from the lesson (
earth, natural, trees, animals, rocks, water)
Word Wall Vocabulary Builder Activity – Slide 22
Students will read and spell their new words:
earth, natural, trees, animals, rocks, water
Teacher will give feedback on the spelling and pronunciation of the new words.
